main event: A Coast Guard ship observed a luminous grayish disc in the sky, estimated to be 5-6000' in diameter, hovering between clouds before rapidly increasing its speed to approximately 600 mph.
interesting points: The commanding officer, originally skeptical of flying saucer reports, witnessed the phenomenon and believed it to be an authentic observation of a flying saucer.
The true cause of the apparition was revealed when an aircraft operating a landing light appeared through a break in the clouds, which would have otherwise been reported as a flying saucer sighting.
The document emphasizes how experienced military personnel can be fooled by light phenomena, suggesting a key to many other similar sightings.
The report recommends forwarding the information to the Air Force group investigating flying saucer reports for its potential interest and value.
This sighting occurred on Ocean Station UNCLE, adding credibility as it was observed by trained Coast Guard personnel.
sighted object: luminous grayish disc in the sky
